alert.note: Alert for Orangeburg (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 09 at 5:48AM EDT until further notice by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in South Carolina... Congaree River At Carolina Eastman affecting Richland, Lexington and Calhoun Counties. Pee Dee River At Cheraw affecting Chesterfield and Marlboro Counties. Congaree River At Congaree National Park-Gadsden affecting Richland and Calhoun Counties. North Fork Edisto River At Orangeburg affecting Orangeburg County. ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in South Carolina... Stevens Creek Near Modoc affecting McCormick and Edgefield Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...North Fork Edisto River At Orangeburg. * WHEN...From this evening until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 8.0 feet, Some minor flooding occurs along the boardwalk at Edisto Gardens. Downstream from the Highway 301 bridge, some roads off Chiquita street near the river begin to flood. At 10.0 feet, Farmland and lowlands along Highway 301 near Orangeburg become flooded at stages above 10 ft. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:00 AM EDT Sunday the stage was 7.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this evening and continue rising to a crest of 9.0 feet Tuesday morning. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. - http://www.floodsafety.noaa.gov &&
info.instruction: Flooding is occurring or is imminent. Most flood related deaths occur in automobiles. Do not attempt to cross water covered bridges, dips, or low water crossings. Never try to cross a flowing stream, even a small one, on foot. To escape rising water find another route over higher ground. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
